title: Tory Brexit Secretary says it will be 'years and years' before Britain shuts door on EU migrants
text:
News Tory Brexit Secretary says it will be 'years and years' before Britain shuts door on EU migrants David Davis warned it would take time to persuade British workers to take badly-paid jobs in hotels, on farms and as carers Share Brexit Secretary David Davis made the comments on a visit to Estonia (Photo: PA) Share Get politics   Thank you for subscribing!   
It will be "years and years” before Britain shuts the door on low-skilled EU migrants, the Tory Brexit Secretary has said. 
David Davis warned it would take time to persuade British workers to take badly-paid jobs in hotels, on farms and as carers. 
His comments, made on Monday on a goodwill trip to Estonia and reported by Bloomberg, expose the struggle Theresa May faces to meet her pledge of cutting net migration below 100,000 a year. 
And it shows up the Leave campaign's claims that Britain would "take back control" over its borders after Brexit . Read More 
The senior minister said: "In the hospitality sector, hotels and restaurants, in the social-care sector, working in agriculture, it will take time. Border controls could be subject to discussion for years (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
"It will be years and years before we get British citizens to do those jobs.” 
He added: "Don’t expect just because we’re changing who makes the decision on the policy, the door will suddenly shut: it won’t.” 
Theresa May’s Brexit White Paper revealed migration may only be curbed through a "phased process of implementation" beyond 2019 - and after complex votes in Parliament. 
Mr Davis continued his tour of the Baltic states today by visiting Latvia and Lithuania in a bid to soften the ground for tough Brexit talks ahead. Read More
